author: Max Rego
description: The White House is continuing its push to remove Federal Reserve board of governors member Lisa Cook, filing a response in federal appeals court ahead of a 3 p.m. deadline on Sunday. The brief, filed in the United States Court of Appeals for the D.C. Circuit, argues that it is within President Trump's discretion to...
title: Trump administration reiterates need to fire Lisa Cook from Fed board

author: Max Rego
description: A public memorial for Charlie Kirk will take place Sept. 21 in Glendale, Ariz., Turning Point USA announced on Saturday.  It will occur inside State Farm Stadium, the home of the NFL’s Arizona Cardinals, which can hold over 63,000 people. Kirk, 31, was fatally shot during an event on the campus of Utah Valley University on Wednesday. The...
title: Charlie Kirk's memorial for Sept. 21 in Arizona

author: Nathaniel Weixel
description: An ObamaCare deadline has collided with a fight over government funding, as Democrats are signaling they want Republicans to extend the law's expiring premium subsidies before they support any bill to keep the government open.   Without action, enhanced tax credits passed during the COVID-19 pandemic to help people afford coverage will expire at the end...
title: ObamaCare fight meets shutdown politics: What to know

author: Max Rego
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said he is "ready" to meet Russian President Vladimir Putin face-to-face to negotiate an end to the war between their countries. "Sometimes we need it. Even if we don't love faces," Zelensky told CNN's Fareed Zakaria to laughter at the Yalta European Strategy Conference on Friday in Kyiv, Ukraine. The interview...
title: Zelensky says he's ready to meet face-to-face with Putin: 'Sometimes we need it. Even if we don't love faces'

author: Addy Bink
description: Even if your device qualifies for the update, you may run into a few delays when iOS 26 becomes available.
title: iOS 26 out soon: When you can get next major iPhone update

author: Tara Suter
description: Rep. Rick Crawford (R-Ark.) said Sunday that Russian President Vladimir Putin is provoking NATO with his recent actions. “We're seeing incursions, possibly in Poland and Romania. He is sticking his thumb in the eye of NATO,” Crawford told NewsNation’s Chris Stirewalt on “The Hill Sunday.” “I don't know if he is trying to invoke an...
title: GOP rep says Putin 'sticking his thumb in the eye of NATO'

author: Katie Wadington
description: Lawmakers, Trump administration officials and other dignitaries will honor the memory of conservative pundit Charlie Kirk at a vigil on Sunday evening. The Kennedy Center will host the D.C. vigil at 6:30 p.m. EDT. Those attending include House Speaker Mike Johnson (R-La.), Director of National Intelligence Tulsi Gabbard, White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt, Health...
title: Lawmakers, Trump administration officials to remember Kirk at Kennedy Center vigil

author: Max Rego
description: House Speaker Mike Johnson (R-La.) on Sunday criticized Rep. Ilhan Omar’s (D-Minn.) comments in the wake of the fatal shooting of Charlie Kirk. Omar, who said she was "mortified" by Kirk’s murder in an interview with Zeteo’s Mehdi Hasan on Thursday, called conservatives who blamed the left for the shooting "full of s---." "She clearly...
title: Johnson criticizes Omar on Kirk comments: 'Clearly' has 'no idea what she's talking about'

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio was greeted by Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Sunday at the Western Wall in Jerusalem, shortly after he arrived in Israel to discuss diplomacy in the region and the war in Gaza. Netanyahu touted the enduring alliance between their two countries, even as Israel’s strike on Hamas leaders in...
title: Rubio meets Netanyahu in Israel to discuss the war in Gaza

author: Stephen Hollingshead, opinion contributor
description: President Trump can use voluntary pilot programs, regulatory technology, and surety bonds to streamline the NEPA permitting process, reduce government bureaucracy, and unlock trillions in promised investment.
title: Streamlining permits with voluntary pilots can lead an economic revival

author: Long Le, opinion contributor
description: Last month, the Trump administration and Nvidia worked out what some have called an unusual and surprising deal for the latter to export its defeatured AI chips.  That is, President Trump reversed a decision made by his own administration to decategorize Nvidia’s H20 and AMD’s chips as a national security risk in a deal that includes a 15 percent levy to...
title: Trump is modeling Chinese state capitalism and there’s no going back

author: Max Rego
description: Sen. John Curtis (R-Utah) called on lawmakers to listen to younger Americans in the wake of the fatal shooting of Charlie Kirk on Sunday. Curtis, who represents the state where the shooting took place on Wednesday, called for those processing Kirk's death to reach out to him via email in a post on the social...
title: Sen. Curtis says 'part of the way we help' younger Americans 'is to listen'

author: Andrew Chakhoyan, opinion contributor
description: In both cases, Charlotte and Ukraine, preventable tragedies unfolded while those with the power to act chose finger-pointing over courage.
title: Hypocritical outrage merchants are exploiting a Ukrainian refugee’s murder

author: Lexi Lonas Cochran
description: The assassination of Charlie Kirk at Utah Valley University has sparked fresh conversations about the security of speakers on campuses and what can be done to improve it as conservatives vow the incident will not scare them from universities.  Both campus and Kirk’s private security were present at Wednesday's debate event, but experts say completely...
title: Spotlight returns to campus security in wake of Charlie Kirk assassination

author: Max Rego
description: Former Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg said on Sunday that "every American is harmed" by the fatal shooting of Charlie Kirk. Kirk, 31, was shot and killed at an event on the campus of Utah Valley University on Wednesday. The conservative activist and founder of Turning Point USA is survived by his wife, Erika, and their...
title: Buttigieg on Kirk shooting: 'Every American is harmed by this'

author: Tara Suter
description: Sen. James Lankford (R-Okla.) said Sunday that “just believing differently than some other American is not illegal” in the wake of conservative activist Charlie Kirk’s death. “I'm a conservative Republican. I have Democratic friends that think very differently, vote very differently, but they're still my friend on it. So, just having that ideology, just believing...
title: Lankford: ‘Just believing differently than some other American is not illegal’

author: Rachel Scully
description: Former U.S. Secretary of Transportation Pete Buttigieg said the Trump administration is not providing the "leadership that we need to bring this country together" after Charlie Kirk was fatally shot last week. During an appearance on NBC's "Meet The Press," Buttigieg was asked about President Trump's video he posted on Truth Social after announcing Kirk's death,...
title: Buttigieg on White House: 'Not getting the leadership that we need to bring this country together'

author: Lyle Goldstein, opinion contributor
description: American national interests will be well served if the two Asian giants can “bury the hatchet” on their decades-long border dispute, embrace compromise and return to more pragmatic bilateral relations.
title: India's thaw in relations with China is nothing to fear

author: Max Rego
description: Utah Gov. Spencer Cox told NBC News’ Kristen Welker on Sunday that while the suspect in Charlie Kirk’s slaying came from a conservative-leaning household, “his ideology was very different than his family.” The alleged gunman, Tyler Robinson, was taken into custody by the FBI late Thursday evening. Robinson, 22, implicated himself in the shooting to...
title: Cox on Kirk suspect coming from conservative home: 'His ideology was very different than his family'

author: Max Rego
description: Rep. Michael McCaul (R-Texas) will not run for re-election in 2026, he told ABC News on Sunday.  McCaul, 63, has represented Texas’ 10th Congressional District, which spans from the Houston suburbs to Austin, since 2005. He also chaired the House Homeland Security and House Foreign Affairs Committees from January 2013 to January 2019 and from...
title: Rep. Michael McCaul announces he will not seek re-election to House

author: Mark R. Whittington, opinion contributor
description: Recently, yet another Apollo astronaut, Jim Lovell, passed on. Lovell’s fame was as defined by his role as a pop culture icon as it was by his astronaut heroics. Everybody who came of age during the Apollo race to the moon knows the name of Captain Jim Lovell. He flew on the missions of Gemini 7,...
title: Apollo 13 made Jim Lovell a legend generations after the space race

description: Has your lawmaker cosponsored daylight saving time legislation this year?
title: Which members of Congress have supported permanent daylight saving time legislation?

description: Fox News host Brian Kilmeade issued an apology on Sunday over a remark he made earlier in the week about homeless people and crime on the air. Kilmeade made the comment during a discussion on Wednesday's edition of "Fox and Friends" about the murder of 23-year-old Iryna Zarutska, a case that has become a flashpoint...

author: Kellye Y. Testy and Austen Parrish, opinion contributors
description: When we were sworn in to the bar, we made an oath to support the Constitution. Now that oath is being put to the test, and each and every one of us needs to stand up for fundamental principles of our legal system.
title: America’s judges are under attack – lawyers have a duty to defend them

author: Glenn C. Altschuler, opinion contributor
description: An infectious disease — one that rejects scientific expertise, metastasizes conspiracy theories and contaminates programs that track and treat illnesses — has entered the body politic of America’s public health agencies.
title: An infectious disease has invaded America’s public health agencies

author: Caroline Vakil
description: Missouri Republicans advanced a new set of congressional lines this month that look to add one pickup opportunity for them in the House ahead of 2026, making them the third state poised to tee up a new House map before the midterms. Legislators in the Show Me State convened for a special session over several...
title: Redistricting: Here are the states likely to come next after Missouri

author: Dominick Mastrangelo
description: An effort by President Trump's administration to curb advertising for pharmaceutical drugs on television is posing creating a potential marketing hurdle for some of the country's largest drugmakers while threatening a key revenue stream for media companies. Advertising and pharmaceutical industry experts say an executive order Trump signed this week could pose an existential threat...
title: Trump effort to target television drug ads could have massive implications

author: Brett Samuels
description: President Trump was meeting with architects about plans for a White House ballroom when staff interrupted to inform him that Charlie Kirk, the prominent conservative activist, had been killed. "I didn't know what they meant. I said, 'What do you mean, dead?'" Trump recounted Friday, two days after the shooting. “‘Charlie Kirk was shot.’ They thought...
title: Why Charlie Kirk's death hits the Trump White House so hard

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: President Trump’s Vatican envoy delivered a special birthday gift to Pope Leo XIV ahead of the pontiff’s 70th celebration on Sunday.  Brian Burch brought a cake from Portillo’s, a popular Chicago food chain, to commemorate the U.S.-born pope’s first birthday as head of the Catholic Church, according to Reuters. Burch told the pope, "Portillo's sent...
title: Trump Vatican envoy gifts Pope Leo birthday cake

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: President Trump, in a Saturday interview, said he hopes the nation heals after the assassination of conservative activist Charlie Kirk, but blamed the “radical left” for being an obstacle in that healing. “I’d like to see it [the nation] heal,” the president said in a brief telephone interview with NBC News. “But we’re dealing with a...
title: Trump says he hopes nation will heal after Kirk assassination but claims ‘radical left’ an obstacle

description: The Charlie Kirk fatal shooting investigation has unveiled the alleged gunman’s ties to the internet and gaming culture amid a national uptick in political violence. The suspected shooter, Tyler Robinson, is currently being held in a Utah jail as the person responsible for Kirk’s death. Police said Robinson, 22, confessed to killing Kirk in private...
title: Bullet engravings in Kirk investigation point to gaming, internet culture
